alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Floyd; Johnson; Knott; Magoffin; Owsley; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 2:48PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Owsley, northwestern Perry, northwestern Knott, northern Floyd, Breathitt and Magoffin Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 248 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Hendricks to Smith Branch to Ricetown. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Salyersville, Mason, Swampton, Royalton, West Royalton Station, Sublett, Skaggs, Conley Station, Marshallville and Sikes around 255 PM EDT. Gypsy, Gapville, Daisydell, Fredville, Noble, Lunah, Ordway, Lambric and Waldo around 300 PM EDT. Decoy, Dotson, Brainard, Barwick, Buck, Bonanza, Whick, Little, Saldee and Orchard around 305 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Lamont, Dock, Chavies, Blue River, Elmrock, Vail, Krypton, Cliff, Evanston, Pyramid, Martin, Allen, Beaver Junction, Dwale, Allen City, Dice, Emma, Lancer, Alvin and Ned. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Breathitt; Floyd; Johnson; Knott; Magoffin; Owsley; Perry
